choices.C: Configure Extract with the FORMATASCII SQLLOADER OPTION.
choices.A: Configure Replicat with the FORMATASCII SQLLOADER OPTION.
choices.D: Configure Replicat with the FORMATXML OPTION.
choices.B: Configure Extract with the FORMATSQL SQLLOADER OPTION.

questions.question_text: You want to generate an extract file or trail in a non-GoldenGate canonical format like those used in the Initial Load file-todatabase utility. How should you configure GoldenGate in order to accomplish this?

Your Extract process, which is using an Oracle database, has stopped with uncommitted transactions. How should you guarantee an efficient recovery after
Extract has stopped?

choices.C: Use the BR parameter to control the bounded recovery feature of the general Extract checkpointing facility.
choices.D: Use the PURGEORPHANEDTRANSACTIONS parameter to control the bounded recovery feature of the general Extract checkpointing facility.
choices.A: Use the FORCETRANS and PURGEORPHANEDTRANSACTIONS parameters to control the bounded recovery feature of the general Extract checkpointing facility.
choices.B: Use the WARNLONGTRANS parameter to control the bounded recovery feature of the general Extract checkpointing facility.

questions.question_text: Which database setting for the Oracle 11.2.0.4 database is required to enable Oracle GoldenGate?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is the correct answer

choices.C: Use Conflict Detection and Resolution in the Replicat parameter file.
choices.D: Use MAPEXCEPTION in the Replicat parameter file.
choices.B: Use HANDLECOLLISION in the Replicat parameter file.
choices.A: Use REPERROR in the Replicat parameter file.
